dialogues.speaker: CREDITS OVER
dialogues.text: Businessmen and women fill the sidewalks, clutching their winter coats shut. Most wear gloves and hats, though they provide little respite from the blustery Midwestern winds Salt-stained Taxis jockey for position. Steam billows fro manhole covers and metal grates. Metro train cars, filled capacity, howl across the frigid track.

dialogues.speaker: HIGH-RISE BUILDING
dialogues.text: The revolving door spins like a carousel, filled with the briefcase-carrying denizens of this busy financial center A sign, situated high above the front security desk: “STARKWEATHER FINANCIAL.” A large Christmas wreath hangs above the sign. The elevator door starts to close. A hand shoots in, stop it. The door reopens. DAVID HARGROVE, 27, more handsome than he probably realiz climbs into the crowded elevator. The other occupants bar move. The door closes -- inches from David’s face. DING. WE TRACK WITH DAVID as he: Exits onto his floor... Walks through the cubicle farm, past the other middle-inc earners and entry-level employees... Sits down in his cubicle. Tosses his car keys into a plas cup filled with pocket change, next to his small desk clo that reads 8:29AM... Pours himself a cup of coffee in the break room... Talks on his office phone, while sneaking in bites from a sandwich... The wall clock shows 1:30PM... He removes a tall stack of files from a drawer and drops on his desk... Talks on the phone some more. Stressed out... David's small, desk clock shows 4:42PM... He enters data into a computer program... Finally lets out a deep sigh. Just another day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s now dark outside. Fluorescent light fills the antiseptic office. People work into the night. The wall clock reads 7:14PM. David sits at his desk, talking on the phone. Or, better described, being talked to. His tie unloosened, his hair mussed, he fails in his effo to keep stress at bay.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: (into phone) Right...I understand. But, there’s so many variables that come into play in a market like this. The voice from the other end of the phone is unintelligib but its tone is unmistakably hostile.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If you'd like, we can explore shifting what's left in your 401K into...I see. COREY THOMPSON, 28, David’s somewhat overbearing and audacious friend and coworker, overhears the conversation Tunes in.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Yes. Yes, sir, I know Christmas is coming. I understand. I’m sorry, Mister Dean. Truly, I’m sorry. I spread the investment risk as wide as I could. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s just the unfortunate state of the economy we’re all -- From the other end of the phone, we hear the muffled soun what sounds a lot like a string of curse words.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hello? Hello, Mister Dean...? (sotto) Shit. David hangs up the phone. Buries his face in his hands. Rubs his temples. Corey wheels back in his chair. Leans into David’s cubicl

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: You lose him?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: What gave it away? David powers down his computer. Corey takes a candy cane off David’s desk. Tears open the plastic wrapper. Pops it into his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: Candy canes taste like shit.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I wouldn’t know. Corey smirks. David looks at himself in the reflection of his powered d computer monitor. His button-down shirt. His loosened tie His messy hair. Corey notices his dejected expression.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: Hey, it’s not your fault.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: (sarcastically) Oh no, who’s fault is it then? (sincere now) I’ve never even met this guy. Just moved some numbers around on the computer and now he’s fucked.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: Everyone’s fucked. So stop moping. David shrugs his acknowledgment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I should have taken today off. Corey looks across the office. Sees EMILY BRANDT, 25, attractive, chatting with a coworker.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: (re: Emily) Ah, but then you would have missed your chance.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: Today’s her last day.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: She's quitting?

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: That’s what I hear.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: No... He watches Emily as she walks back toward her cubicle.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: Stop being such a bitch and go ask her out.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I tried that a year ago. I made an ass out myself.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: Yeah, because you couldn’t say the word date. What did you call it again...?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I asked her if she wanted to meet up for...a gathering.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: A gathering? What is she, a fucking wizard?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: No idea why I said it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right, you did make an ass out yourself. David ignores Corey. Collects the last of his belongings.

dialogues.speaker: COREY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come on, come on -- I’m just messing with you. Go talk to her.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I can’t.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: Why can’t you?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Because...I left my balls at home.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: Not again.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Yup, right there on the dresser.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: Next to your nightgown?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Right next to it. In fact, it’s probably covering them a little bit, keeping them warm.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: Like a male penguin.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Like a male penguin. I don’t know what that means. David grabs his jacket and car keys.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’1l see you on Monday.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: What about the Christmas party?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Eh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don’t give me “eh.” We're meeting everyone at Max’s in, like, twenty minutes.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Shouldn’t I go home and change first?

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: You're fine; everybody's going straight from the office.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Oh...I get it now. Male penguins sit on the eggs to keep them warm...like my balls.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: You got it right away. Stop trying to change the subject -- the party’s going to be fun.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Are Jerry and Luke going?

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: Yeah. Everybody from our department is. Besides, I need a ride.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: You know all those yellow cars out there? It’s crazy, all you need to do is give them some money and they drive you wherever --

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: -- Yeah, yeah, yeah. Just give me a second. I gotta’ take a piss.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: (through a smile) I’m not going.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: Yeah you are. You wanna’ know why? David's already given up. Raises his eyebrows to say “Why

dialogues.speaker: COREY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (re: Emily) Because she’s going, too. Corey walks off, leaving David to reconsider, and then y from afar.

dialogues.speaker: COREY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This is going to be a big night for you, bro. I can feel it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Busy bar scene. Young professionals enjoy after-work drin at their company Christmas party. Some enjoy too many, evidenced by Corey’s obvious inebriation. He and David sit at a table, along with coworkers CHRISTI JERRY, and LUKE. High-ball glasses cover the table. Corey iPhone also sits on the table, in front of him. Emily stands across the room, speaking with friends at th bar. Back at the table, Corey holds court.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: So I purposely order the pizza at, like, three minutes before midnight.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: On New Year’s Eve?

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: (to the group) What’s going on for New Year’s this year?

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: Who gives a shit? I’m not done with my story.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: It’s going to be Easter by the time you are.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: Yeah, whatever. Go fuck yourself. Anyway...where was I?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: New Year’s. You ordered a pizza.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right, right. So, three minutes passes, the ball drops, it’s officially the new year. Lo and behold, ten minutes later there’s a knock on my door.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Was it the point of the story finally showing up? David listens in. Laughs. Glances over at the bar, where sees Emily. She looks back at him. Their gaze holds for a moment, but then they both look away.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: It was the pizza guy. So, I tell him, “You better not be charging me for this. I ordered the fucking thing last year!” The punchline receives a few courtesy chuckles.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Did you end up paying?

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: No. The kid apologized and -- As Corey plops back down into his seat, Corey accidentall bangs into the table and knocks his iPhone onto the floor He doesn’t notice. He also spills everyone's drinks. That, everyone notices.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTIAN
dialogues.text: Ah, man. What the hell?

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: Shit. My bad, my bad. Corey pulls out his wallet. Grabs all his cash. Calls ove a COCKTAIL WAITRESS.

dialogues.speaker: COREY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (hands her all his cash) Sweetie, here. Bring a bottle of tequila to the table. Best stuff you got.

dialogues.speaker: COCKTAIL WAITRESS
dialogues.text: It’s five more dollars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh...um... Corey searches his pockets. David stands up and places a ten dollar bill on the Cockt Waitresses’ tray. He walks away from the table. WE STAY ON DAVID as he crosses the bar. Readies himself. Approaches the bar, next to Emily. Tries to make his selection of that spot seem random. He signals the bartender.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: (to the bartender) Another beer. Thanks. He turns and looks at Emily.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Oh...hey, Emily.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: Hi, David. The bartender brings David his beer.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: (to Emily) Did you want anything?

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: No, I’m good, thanks. I’m leaving, actually.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I heard that. Emily’s slightly confused.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: You heard I was leaving?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Yeah. Corey told me you got a job at an NPO.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: Oh, right...I did. I meant I was leaving...never mind.  10.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Well, congrats. Needed a change, I guess.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: Thanks, yeah I think I’ve gone about as far as I can handle in finance.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I know what you mean. Neither of them seems to know where to go from here. The extended silence is a bit awkward.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So...I should probably get going.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Right...

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: Thanks for the drink -- well, the offer.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Of course. Yeah. And, ah, you know...maybe I’1l catch you later...or something.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: Umm...yeah. Emily grabs her coat and purse. Walks off. David winces. Dies a little on the inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cars and taxis speed past. Their exhaust mixes with the c air, clouding up the street. Emily walks from the bar and is instantly hit by an achin cold gust of wind. She extends a shivering arm to signal cab, but it passes her by. David exits the bar, carrying a winter hat. Catches up to her.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Emily, wait... Emily turns to face who called her. Sees it’s David. A hopeful smile crosses her face.  11.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You forgot your hat.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: Oh...that’s not mine.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Shit. Did I just steal a hat?

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: I think you may have.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Well, consider it a going away present...from whoever owns it.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: I’m not going far. My new office is only a few blocks uptown. David goes for broke.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Want to grab lunch some time?

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: Ummm.... Crash and burn. David quickly recoils.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: It’s cool. I understand...

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: No, no -- I would. Sorry. I’m nervous.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Nervous? About what?

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: About this. About us talking right now.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: Yes. She reaches out to another passing taxi.  12. It, too, does not stop. She grows frustrated. Cold. She moves to a spot further down the street. David walks with her.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: We've talked plenty of times before. Wearing only his button-down work shirt, the cold is alre taking its toll on David. He folds his arms for warmth. Tries to rub life back into his limbs.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: At work, yeah. You’d call me at my desk, ask me about a financial report, but that was it.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I never cared about the reports. They smile at each other. Their breath escapes into the c nighttime air. A cab speeds past. Emily misses the chance to signal it. Standing in the spot she stood moments ago are two women. The cab stops for them and they climb in.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: (re: the missed cab) Damn it... A bone-chilling gust of wind blows through. Emily clutche her coat closer to her chest and neck. David turns away slightly, letting the brunt of the wind hit his back. Once it passes:

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I can give you a ride home. Emily considers it, but then:

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: I live outside the city. It’s really out of the way. Another cab passes without stopping.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Come on, it’s freezing out here. I‘1l grab my jacket and we'll go. More cold wind blows through. It chills them to the bone.  13.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: That would be great. Thanks. He hurries back toward the bar. Emily yells over to him.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You should probably return that hat. INT. MAX’S - MOMENTS LATER The bar is just as busy as it was when we last left it. David enters -- He places the hat on the back of a chair. Leaves it there Walks to his table. An almost full bottle of top-shelf tequila sits on it, along with several empty shot glasses

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I'm taking off.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: Already? David's lips form a modest smile.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I'm giving Emily a ride home. The guys at the table applaud.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: See? And here it is you didn’t even want to come tonight. David smirks. Puts on his winter jacket.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I’1ll see you guys on Monday.

dialogues.speaker: LUKE
dialogues.text: Alright, playboy.

dialogues.speaker: JERRY
dialogues.text: Congrats. David's about to leave the table. He notices that Corey h put on his own jacket, which is half soaked from when he spilt the drinks.  14.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: (patting down his jacket) Damn.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: What are you doing? Corey puts his jacket over his arm instead.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: What do you mean, what am I doing? We're leaving.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Well, I’m leaving...

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: Yeah. And you’re my ride home.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Can’t you take a cab?

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: I don’t have any more cash on me. Slightly frustrated, David takes out his own wallet. He doesn’t have much cash either.

dialogues.speaker: COREY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'll just go with you now.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I told you, I’m bringing Emily home.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: I know. Just drop me off on the way.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Corey...

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: It’ll take ten minutes.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: You live twenty minutes away.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: What am I supposed to do -- walk?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: (sighs) Okay. Let’s go.  15. Corey swipes the bottle of tequila off the table and hide under his jacket. Off the guys’ chagrined looks:

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: What? I’m the one who bought it. David walks away, toward the exit, with Corey following c behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long stretch of darkened, suburban road, lit by the occasional street light. Small, snow-capped homes appear sporadically. The chilled limbs of wintry trees spread like spindly, bony fingers, hovering just above the road. A set of headlights cut through the darkness. INT. CAR -— CONTINUOUS David drives as Emily rides in the passenger seat, doing best to warm her hands near the dashboard vents. She stares out the window, watching the dark world outsid speed past her. Corey sits in the backseat, his bottle of tequila in hand He sips from it as he talks, unnecessarily loudly, on a c phone.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: (into phone) Check my seat. Nothing? How about under the table? Yeah. Yeah, it’s an iPhone. Nice. Leave it on my desk tomorrow. Luke? Leave it...you there? Yo? Corey looks at the cell phone. It’s powered down.

dialogues.speaker: COREY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to David, re: the phone) Your battery’s dead. David plugs his car charger into the cigarette lighter.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: (re: the cell phone) Let me see it.  16. David reaches his hand behind him, but Corey throws the p over David’s shoulder, onto the front seat. It lands on t floor, in a small crevice on the side of the seat.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Dude...? David reaches for the phone, but his hand doesn’t fit. He gives up. Leaves it there. They continue driving. David looks over at Emily, who kee her hands pressed against the heating vents. He slides of his jacket.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: (placing the jacket over her lap like a blanket) Here.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: (smiles) Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m sorry by the way.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: For what?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I realize this is out of the way...

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: It's fine. Honestly. (beat) I’m enjoying the company. David and Emily share a flirtatious smirk. From the backseat, loudly:

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: It’s true, I am good company. Take this left. Corey tells David to take the turn just as he reaches the street. David swerves slightly, but readjusts.

dialogues.speaker: COREY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don’t worry about it. You can take the next one. David continues driving.  17. After a beat:

dialogues.speaker: COREY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m starving. No response. Corey tries again.

dialogues.speaker: COREY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You know what I’m saying?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Yeah, that you’re hungry. I get it.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: Let’s grab something to eat.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: It's after midnight.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: And? What am I, a fuckin’ gremlin?

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: Yes. David smirks.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Eat at home.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: I don’t have anything. C’mon, just stop somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Nothing’s open.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: There’s a pizza place near here that serves slices till two. Corey's clearly too drunk to be getting the hint. David tries a more direct approach.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I kind of want to, you know, bring Emily home...

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: It’ll take two seconds. I swear, I'll stop this masterclass in cock- blocking right after that.  18. David looks at Emily. She laughs. David ends up doing the same.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: You're killing me right now.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: Cool. Oh yeah, I need to stop at an ATM.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Just use your debit card.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: They only take cash...unless you wanna’ spot me --—

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Where’s the ATM?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Large and dark, the lot is a vast expanse of empty area. Yellow lines demarcate the hundreds of parking spaces, th none are occupied. It’s quite barren. Eerie. Not the best part of town, either. The supermarket is closed for the night. A long, frozen, industrial hose snakes from the building to the rows of Douglas-fir trees lined near its entrance. The trees’ chilled limbs dance in the strong winds. Festooned above them, a large banner reads: “CHRISTMAS TR FOR SALE.” Nearby, beneath the supermarket’s main sign, is a large t and temperature sign. Current time: 1:18am. Temperature: negative 3 degrees Fahrenheit. Across from the supermarket, in a remote area of the park lot, sits a standalone ATM vestibule owned by BANK OF THE MIDWEST. The large, glass-encased ATM vestibule remains o for 24-hour use. David's car pulls up near the ATM vestibule. Not far, but not exactly close, either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emily opens her door. lLeans her seat forward. Corey squeezes through, squashing Emily in the process.  19.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: I’ll be back in a second. Leaving his damp jacket in the car, Corey hurries over to entrance. The ATM vestibule shines like a beacon in the otherwise darkened parking lot. Its many windows are partially fros from the extreme cold. Corey takes a long pull from the bottle of tequila he bri with him. David and Emily watch from the car as Corey inserts his A card into the outside security reader. He pulls open the and he enters. Neither says a word at first. Silence, sav for the idling engine and the steady sound of heat escapi the vents.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I‘1ll make sure he’s fast at the pizza place...

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: I really don’t mind.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: They actually make pretty decent pizza. The mushroom and, um, and something...garlic, I think, is pretty good. They cook it all up and stuff. It’s good. Off David’s stammering:

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: I thought I was the nervous one. David jokingly puffs up.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? I’m not nervous.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: Catch you later?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Well that was -- okay, I was a little nervous then, but...

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: I like it. It’s cute.  20. Emily smiles. She notices a pewter clip -- featuring Sain Christopher -- attached to David’s visor.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (re: the clip) What’s that? David seems slightly embarrassed.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Oh, it’s nothing. Emily leans in and reads the inscription. Her shoulder touches David’s. Her touch electrifies him.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: “Protect me and my passengers and all who pass by with a steady hand and a watchful eye.”

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: It’s stupid. I don’t know why I even have it.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: I think it’s nice. There’s nothing wrong with having a little faith. Their conversation is interrupted by the distant sight of Corey in the ATM vestibule. It’s clear by his body langua that he’s aggravated about something.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (re: Corey) Uggg...what is it now? Corey turns to face them. Throws his hands up in resigned defeat.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You've got to be kidding me. David gets out of the car. Leaves his jacket behind on Emily's lap. Jogs over to the ATM vestibule. WE STAY ON EMILY as she watches David using his own ATM c to let himself into the vestibule. He and Corey have a br discussion, ending with David’s obvious displeasure. Emily looks around while holding her cold hands closer to heat. The emptiness and dark surroundings make her visibl uneasy.  21. After a moment, she turns off the car. Removes the keys f the ignition. Still wearing her coat, she exits the car a hurries over the ATM. WE SEE that she left behind her pur Corey opens the door and lets her into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Large, both in length and height, the vestibule is quite roomy inside. Close to fifteen feet across. Thirteen feet high ceilings. Glass windows cover three sides of the rectangle shaped vestibule. Its fourth side is a dull, white plaster wall, cluttered with Bank of the Midwest advertisements. Off to one side of this wall is an Automated Teller Machine (ATM David stands at the ATM, going through the process of get cash. INSERT - The P.O.V. from the silent, black and white vide camera situated in the ATM: David, with Emily and Corey in the background, stands in front of the ATM. He punches in his PIN.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: (to Emily) What’s wrong?

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: Nothing. I didn’t want to wait in the car.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I‘1l just be a second.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: (to David) Why are you taking out money? David rolls his eyes over in Corey’s direction. Corey notices.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: Cockhead, I’1l pay you back. (to Emily, kinder) The magnetic strip on my card’s messed up.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: Cockhead?  22.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: Just a little pet name I have for him. Emily chuckles. Corey, who left his coat in the car, blow into his hands for warmth.

dialogues.speaker: COREY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It's freakin’ freezing in here. Emily agrees with a nod. Corey places his cold hands agai a small heating vent located along the bottom of the plas wall. It offers a small amount of relief. Transaction complete. David takes his cash. Grabs his receipt. Throws it in a waste basket.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: All set, let’s go. Leading the way, Emily places her hand on the vestibule d - on the EXIT LEVER. She’s about to press the lever and o the door, when suddenly -- -- she stops. Corey and David look at her.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: What? She doesn’t move. Not a muscle. Her eyes are fixed on something straight ahead in the dark parking lot. Corey and David turn their attention to what she stares a Standing there, about thirty feet from the door, is a MAN formidably sized man, at that. Shrouded in darkness, wear a heavy, hooded parka. He doesn’t move -- he simply stands and stares. WE CANNOT SEE his face, only the faint wisps of steam as curl from his mouth in the cold winter air. David, Emily and Corey stop dead in their tracks. They ne exit the vestibule.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Who the hell is that? David looks at his own hand, which is full of cash. Practically on display.  23. He quickly stuffs the cash into his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: Who gives a shit? Let’s go. Corey puts his hands on the door, about to open it and ex David warily grabs Cory by the shirt.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: No, wait...

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: For what?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Just wait. Corey stands down. The three of them stare outside at the Man. He stares back.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Why’s he out there?

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: He’s probably waiting to use the ATM.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: Why didn’t he come in, then?

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: Who cares? I’m freezing. Let’s go.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Damn it, Corey. Wait. Corey stops. Let’s out an annoyed sigh.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: The fucking guy wants to use the ATM. Big deal.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: Where’s his card?

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: Probably in his wallet.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: What if he wants to rob us?  24.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: He’s not here to rob us.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Corey, it’s one in the morning. Why would this guy be in the middle of an empty parking lot?

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: (re: the ATM) The same reason we’re here.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Did we walk here? Alone? Corey looks at the Man for a beat. Considers David's assertion. After a beat:

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: This is retarded. I’m leaving. Corey opens the door and starts to exit. The very second does -- -- the Man takes a step closer to the ATM vestibule. Seeing this, Corey freezes. After a beat, he then slowly steps back inside the vestibule. Closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: What was that? Why did he do that?

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: Maybe...maybe he thought we were done, so he could finally come in. They wait. Continue to look outside at the Man. He does t same right back at them.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: Should we call the police?

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: (to David) I think we should. David doesn’t respond. He holds his attention on the Man.  25.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: Let’s just ask him why he’s here, then.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: No...

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Corey, no. Corey knocks on the glass. Calls out to the Man.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: Hey, buddy. You waiting to use the

dialogues.speaker: ATM
dialogues.text: The Man does not respond. He continues to stand and stare Unflinchingly.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: (unnerved) What does he want, then?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Probably our money. (beat) Does he have anything on him? Can you see?

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: I...I can’t tell.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: Are you guys serious right now? Who cares about this jerk-off? Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Says the guy who just got scared back into the booth.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: Whatever. If we all leave at once, we'll be fine. Come on. Corey puts his hands on the door, prepared to exit. David grabs onto him again.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Wait -- will you just wait?! Corey shakes David's grip off of him.  26.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: For what? I want to go eat. David looks outside. The Man stares back, still standing the same spot in the parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: He’s just...watching us.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE VESTIBULE
dialogues.text: The Man stands and stares at David, Emily and Corey. They stare out at him.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE VESTIBULE
dialogues.text: Emily, David and Corey keep their attention on the Man. Confused. Slightly fearful. Growing colder with each passing minute.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: Maybe he’s homeless.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: He probably is. So, give hima fin and let’s call it a night.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: He doesn’t look homeless.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: What makes someone not look homeless?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: When they’re that big. Just then, the Man’s head WHIPS around. A faint jingling sound grows louder and louder. Someone’s coming.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE VESTIBULE
dialogues.text: ROBERT, 43, a random man walking his dog, ambles through parking lot, a hundred feet or so behind the Man. A medallion on his Golden Retriever’s collar jingles with e step.

dialogues.speaker: ROBERT
dialogues.text: (to his dog) Alright, go ahead. Robert lets go of the dog’s leash. It runs off into the dark.  27.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE VESTIBULE
dialogues.text: David, Emily and Corey watch as Robert comes into view. The Man walks over to Robert with a determined step.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE VESTIBULE
dialogues.text: Robert stands and waits for his dog to return. Bounces on the balls of his feet to keep warm. He then notices David, Emily and Corey in the ATM vestibu They all stand at the door, watching intently. He appears find this somewhat odd. Robert then sees the Man approaching.

dialogues.speaker: ROBERT
dialogues.text: How’s it going? The Man continues toward him. Doesn't say a word.

dialogues.speaker: ROBERT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Just letting my dog do his business. The Man continues his approach, undeterred. Robert sudden appears to feel slightly threatened.

dialogues.speaker: ROBERT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Is there...uh, something I can help you -- SMASH! Without a moment of hesitation, the Man PUNCHES Robert in the face. Drops him.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: Oh my God! David bangs against the glass, trying to stop the Man.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Hey! Hey!!

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE VESTIBULE
dialogues.text: The Man GRABS Robert’s head in his big, meaty hands, wrap in dark leather gloves and -- -- SMASH-SMASH!! Against the concrete. Like an animal. Blood trickles out from Robert’s head.  28.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: Holy shit. Did you see that? Did you see that?!

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: David...

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE VESTIBULE
dialogues.text: The Man removes Robert's wallet from his back pocket. Doesn't open it. Stuffs it into his own jacket pocket. He leaves Robert’s bloodied body in the middle of the par lot. No care. No remorse. He walks back toward the vestibule. Well behind him, Robert’s Golden Retriever returns. Nudge him a few times with his snout. Whimpers. Robert doesn’t move. The dog walks away, its leash dragging behind on th ground.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE VESTIBULE
dialogues.text: They watch in horror as the Man returns to where he was originally standing. He plants himself there. As if nothi happened. David frantically reaches into his pocket. Searches. Nothing. Reaches into his other pocket. Same result.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Damn it! (to Emily and Corey) Call nine-one-one. Call them! Corey throws his hands up. He doesn’t have his phone, remember? David looks to Emily. She sheepishly answers.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: My phone’s in my purse.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Where’s your purse? Emily looks outside.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: In the car.  29. Corey starts frantically looking around next to the ATM.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: (running his fingers along the underside of the ATM) Don’t they have panic buttons in these things?

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: Yeah they must. They all join in looking for the button, but can’t find i

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Shit, what about a hard line?

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I don’t know, like an elevator phone. A speaker thing that connects directly to the bank.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: Right, right. They all continue looking around, but still they find nothing.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: This can’t be happening. But it is. The three of them stare at each other, all pleading for an idea. They’ve got nothing. The gravity of the situation fully takes hold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chilling winds scream through the empty lot, knocking one the Christmas trees over. A small chain, fastened to its trunk, keeps it from blowing away. A few pieces of trash roll about like suburban tumbleweed The time and temperature sign provides its update. Curren time: 1:52am. Temperature: negative 5 degrees Fahrenheit. The ATM vestibule sits in the distance, aglow in the dark winter night.  30.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David paces back and forth, futilely hugging his arms clo to his body for warmth. Corey kneels near the wall, his hands near the heating ve He takes a warming sip from the bottle of tequila. Emily clenches her jacket closed as she stares into the parking lot. Her teeth chatter behind her dry, pallid lip She can’t take her frightened eyes off the Man, who slowl circles the vestibule like a shark. A predator.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: There has to be something. Something we can do to, I don’t know, get someone’s attention.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: Who? There’s no one else out there.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: There was that guy with his dog.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: And look what happened to him. David takes this into account.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: (re: the Man) Why hasn’t he come in here? Corey and David look outside at the Man. Study him as the talk to each other.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Maybe he doesn’t have an ATM card.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: Why would that stop him?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: You need it for the buzzer thing.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: What if the dog guy has one?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Has he checked?  31.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: How the fuck should I know? Their concern escalates.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: What are we going to do? David looks over at the car. It’s parked a good distance away.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Where are my keys? Emily digs into her jacket pocket. Removes David’s keys, well as a tube of lipstick. She hands David his keys.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Maybe I can get to the car.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: You’1l never make it.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: You don’t know that.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: David, the guy’s right there. You'll be lucky to get within ten feet of it.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE VESTIBULE
dialogues.text: The Man notices that all three of them look in the direct of the car. It’s obvious what they’re considering. He walks toward the car.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: What’s he doing?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Shit -- I think he heard us.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE VESTIBULE
dialogues.text: The Man opens the driver’s side door. Leans in. Fiddles around near the steering wheel, though WE CANNOT SEE what he’s doing. He then pushes a button to pop the trunk. Closes the driver’s side door.  32. After standing in front of it for a moment -- with his ba facing the vestibule -- he then retreats to the back of t car. Opens the trunk. A faint light emits from a small bulb. T Man carelessly rummages through the junk inside, throwing much of it to the ground, including an old, folding lawn chair. He finds a tire iron, apparently what he was looking for. Grabs it. He then spots a small tool kit. Takes that, too

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE VESTIBULE
dialogues.text: They watch as the Man closes the trunk, carrying the tire iron and tool kit. He walks away from the car, toward the vestibule. Continu walking, until he’s out of sight, presumably behind the vestibule.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: Is he leaving? David places his face against where the last pane of glas meets the plaster wall, trying to see the Man.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: No...I can’t tell. I think he went around back. Shit. David peels away from the window.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: What should we do? They all look at one other. At the car. At the open parki lot. Decision time. INSERT - The P.O.V. from the silent, black and white secu camera in the ATM: David, Emily and Corey stand near one another, looking unnerved. Discomposed. Scared.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Still no sign of the Man. Silence, except for the steady hum of the small rotor in heating vent.  33. David's foot lifts from the floor. Slowly. It lands one step closer to the door. He waits a second for a reaction of some kind. But there’ none. Has the Man left? As David begins to take another step --

dialogues.speaker: -- BANG
dialogues.text: The sound of metal striking metal. Coming from the back o the vestibule, behind the plaster wall. David, Emily and Corey WHIP around to face the plaster wa BANG-BANG-BANG-BANG-BANG!! It echoes through the vestibul Followed by a screeching sound. Metal scraping metal. David waits a beat, and then:

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: (to Emily, hushed) Your cell phone...you’re positive it’s in your purse? Emily nods.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: On the front seat? Corey looks over at David, figuring out what he’s driving

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: No...

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: He’s back there. By the time he gets around the booth, I’1l be halfway to the car.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: And what about the other half of the way? BANG-BANG-BANG!! Even louder this time. Emily, Corey and David watch as the plaster wall rattles slightly. Followed only by the continuous hum of the heating vent. And then the faint sound of what sounds like a metal obje being dropped onto the ground is heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hushed) He has a gun. David shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: He would have shot at us by now.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: This glass is probably bullet- proof.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: No, it’s not.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: We should just wait. It’1ll be light out soon. This parking lot will be filled with people.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: The sun won't be up for hours. We'll be lucky if we don’t freeze to death before then. 34. David's right. The clouds of breath that escape his mouth are proof of this.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: This is fucking insane. Corey rests his head against the glass. Defeated.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: (pleading with her eyes) It’s too dangerous. David meets Emily’s heartfelt stare. His adrenaline is momentarily stifled as he considers what to do. And then -- -- POOF-POOF-POOF... The overhead fluorescent lights blow out in succession. vestibule turns almost pitch black inside, save for the of the ATM display screen.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Terrific. After a few short BEEPS, the emergency lights kick in. The light They are not nearly as bright. The vestibule remains quite dar  35.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: What the hell was that? What happened?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: He cut the power.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: Oh no. David and Corey turn to see what concerns Emily. She’s crouched down near the heating vent. It’s silent.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: No...no, no... Corey bangs the bottom of his fist against the vent. Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: COREY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: shit.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: He’s back. Corey lifts his head. Sees that the Man is back in view. stands about fifteen feet from the vestibule. And then, something occurs to David. Looking at the glass window pane --

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Wait...wait-wait-wait...

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: What is it? Without explanation, David suddenly bangs against the fro windows several times. Hard. But the glass shows no sign compromise.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What are you doing?!

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: The glass -- there’s got to be an alarm on it or something. David bangs harder, all to no avail.  36.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: But if you break it, he’ll be able to get in. She's got a point.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: All right...then something else. David looks around the vestibule. His eyes lock on the plaster wall. He KICKS at it. Repeatedly. Frantically. It dents. Deforms. Cory joins in. SMASHES his shoulder into the plaster wall over and over again. Pieces of drywall fall to the ground. But still, no alarm

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Damn it!! Emily's eyes drift upward. Something catches her attentio

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: Wait... David and Corey stop.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: Those will have an alarm. David looks up to where Emily stares. He sees what she se the emergency fire sprinklers.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Do you have a lighter?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Shit. No. (to Corey) You? Corey shakes his head “No.” Out of breath, David looks at the ATM itself. Without any hesitation, he storms over to it. WHAM!! He delivers a KICK right at it. Nothing.  37. INSERT - The ATM's silent, black and white security camer

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David repeatedly KICKS the ATM.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE VESTIBULE
dialogues.text: The Man watches the chaos from the shadows. David finally gives up. Corey does the same. They fight t catch their breath. Slightly muffled by the glass:

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Come on!!!

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE VESTIBULE
dialogues.text: David is at a loss. Still laboring to catch his breath in the cold air, he slowly approaches the glass. Sees someth in the distance. His eyes widen. He bangs the glass. Yells out.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Hey! Hey!! Over here!! Emily and Corey see what David is looking at: a car -- wi emergency lights on its roof. It has just pulled into the distant entrance of the parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: It’s the cops.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: Hey!! Help us!! But, the car circles back around, never coming close to t bank.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: Come back! Please!! The car’s taillights disappear into the night, behind the cover of white cloud exhaust. It’s too late -- it’s gone. None of them have a clue what to do next.  38. After a beat:

dialogues.speaker: EMILY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m so cold.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Me too. Emily paces to the other side of the vestibule. Shivers.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to Corey) How much do you have in your account?

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: I’m not sure. Why?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I’ve got close to three grand. David approaches the ATM. Inserts his card. Punches buttons.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: You're not going to give this asshole money?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: He just fucking beat a guy to death, Corey. If it means us getting out of here alive, absolutely. Something’s wrong.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Damn...

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: (re: the ATM) It‘ll only let me take out four hundred.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I already took out a hundred. There’s a daily limit.  39. David goes forward with the withdrawal anyway.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to Corey) You take out five hundred, too. Maybe a thousand will be enough. David grabs his cash. Takes back his ATM card.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: I told you, my card’s not working.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Shit. That’s right. David gives Corey a once-over. Notices his watch.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: What about that?

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Your watch.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: No fucking way am I giving this to him. Emily takes off her diamond stud earrings.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: Here. Take these. David looks down at the earrings. After a beat he reluctantly takes them.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: (to Corey) It’s just a watch, Corey.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: The thing’s been in my family forever. I can’t...

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Look, I know it’s important to you, but...we need it.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: No. I’m not doing it.  40.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: You’re unbelievable.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: Fine, I’m unbelievable. David gives up. Stares at the cash and earrings he holds hand, clearly questioning if it is going to be enough. Now what? Emily huddles her arms close to her body for warmth. She trembles. As she stares outside, almost in a state of catatonia, she has a frightening realization.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: (to Corey) Wait...if your card’s not working, how did you get in?

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: What do you mean? After a moment, David appears to figure out what Emily’s driving at. He instantly becomes equally concerned.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: She means, if the magnetic strip on your card’s messed up, like you said it is, how were you able to get past the security buzzer?

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: Who gives a shit?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Please tell me you were just being cheap.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: What? David's panic grows tenfold. His words are pleas for comfort.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Your card works fine. You were just too cheap to take out money, right, Corey? Corey finally gets it, evidenced by his sudden look of disquietude.  41.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Corey...? He slowly shakes his head to say “No.” David and Emily look at each other. Fear stains their fac David takes slow, trepidant steps over to the vestibule d He looks at it. Terrified. He slowly extends his tremblin hand until his fingertips make contact with the icy glass Without pressing the EXIT LEVER, he gently, and ever so slightly, pushes the glass door itself -- -- and it OPENS. A chilling wind whistles in through the small space. His outstretched hand quivers. The locking mechanism on t door is clearly broken. In short: The door is unlocked. David looks outside for the Man. He’s nowhere in sight. B still, did he see this? David nervously pulls back his hand, closing the barely- opened vestibule door. He backs away. After a beat, David signals to Corey. “Give it.” Corey removes his wristwatch. Hands it to David. David approaches a signing shelf, affixed to one of the g walls of the vestibule. He grabs an ATM deposit envelope. Reaching into his pocket, he removes all his cash. Stuffs into the envelope. Same for Corey’s watch and Emily’s earrings. Seals the envelope. His cold, shaking hands make these fi movements difficult. David signals Emily and Corey over. They huddle around hi He holds the deposit envelope in hand.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I’m going to slide this to the side of him -- away from the door. If he goes for it, we run the other way, toward the main road.  42.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: Yeah. Okay. It's apparent that Emily is less confident in the plan.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: (to Emily) What’s wrong?

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: What if there are more of them out there?

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: More of what?

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: Him. Emily looks outside for the Man.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How do we know he’s alone?

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE VESTIBULE
dialogues.text: The Man stands at the rear of the vestibule, out of their sight. The tool box the Man removed earlier from David’s trunk i the ground. Its cover open, WE SEE a spool of wire amongs its contents. In front of him is a steel door, encased by a brick wall, that appears to lead inside the vestibule. He tries to pr open the door with the tire iron. No luck. He then picks a screwdriver in one hand and a hammer in the other. The Man places the screwdriver to the already damaged loc He is about to strike the end of the screwdriver with the hammer when he overhears Corey, David and Emily OFF-SCREE He stops. Listens. It’s difficult to hear them, but it sounds as though they’re having a disagreement over something.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Emily’s right, it’s too risky.

dialogues.speaker: COREY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: There’s no one else out there.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: You don’t know that.  43.

dialogues.speaker: COREY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Neither do you!

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I’1l go alone.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: No, David.

dialogues.speaker: COREY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: You're not stranding us here.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I’m not stranding anybody. If I make it to the car, I can go get help. The Man quietly places the tools on the ground. Walks to side of the brick wall. Peers around it. Waits.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE VESTIBULE
dialogues.text: INSERT - P.O.V. from the black and white security camera, situated inside the ATM. The image is slightly obscured, caused earlier when David smashed the ATM with his foot: With the deposit envelope in hand, David slowly approache the door. Corey and Emily stand close behind him. The security camera image only captures the inside of the vestibule, but only a few feet outside.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE VESTIBULE
dialogues.text: David opens the door. Halfway. Seconds later, he takes a single step outside. He is hit by a blast of arctic air. His button-down, collared shirt does little to keep him w The Man slowly emerges from behind the vestibule. Ready. David takes a second step outside. He turns around to fac Corey and Emily. David signals them with an apprehensive nod. They respond they're clearly supposed to -- by closing the door behind him. For the first time since all this started, David is outsi the vestibule. Alone. Vulnerable. He looks around. Nervous. Scared. No sign of the Man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then, from out of the shadows, he emerges. Standing approximately twenty feet in front of David, his heavy breaths escape from the hood of his parka. David holds out the envelope.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: There’s...there’s five hundred dollars in here...plus, everything we have. A pair of earrings, a watch. It’s yours, all of it. Please...just let us go. The Man doesn’t react. He just continues to stare. Corey and Emily watch, nervously, from behind the glass. The bitter cold stings David’s cheeks, transforming his breath into vapor.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We won’t tell the police about any of this. We’ve never even seen your face, so...so you can just take this... David slides the envelope full of valuables across the concrete, off to the side -- away from the door.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: .»-and...you know, disappear. Like nothing happened. Okay? Is that...is that okay? The Man is yet to move. Silence. The tension is palpable. And then, after a long beat -- -- the Man takes a step in the direction the envelope. Finally, a glimmer of hope. Step by lumbering step, the Man gets closer to the envelo and further away from David. And the car. David surreptitiously removes his car keys from his pocke Waits the for the right moment to make his move. Waits... Waits...... Waits........  45. Now!

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: sprints across the parking lot, toward the car.

dialogues.speaker: THE MAN
dialogues.text: sees him and gives up entirely on the envelope. Walks, qu resolutely, toward David.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: reaches the car. Pulls on the door handle. It’s locked. H immediately clicks the unlock button on the key, but it remains locked -- -- He looks down to see the lock is jammed with something The pewter visor clip of St. Christopher.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Shit!

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE VESTIBULE
dialogues.text: Corey bangs on the glass. Emily yells out, frantically.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: He’s coming!!

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: looks through the car window at the passenger side. That door is unlocked. He turns around to check on...

dialogues.speaker: THE MAN,
dialogues.text: who is almost on him.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: runs around the car. Reaches the passenger side. Yanks at the door -- -- it opens. Relief. Momentary.

dialogues.speaker: THE MAN
dialogues.text: rounds the front of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: leaps inside. Slides over to the driver's side. Inserts t key into the ignition. Turns it -- -- Click. Nothing. A broken panel exposes torn wires hanging from the ignition.

dialogues.speaker: THE MAN
dialogues.text: gets within feet of the passenger side door.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: locks the passenger side door. He then spots Emily’s purse on the floor. He hurriedly rummages through it. Finds her cell phone. Dials 9-1-1. I just abut to press SEND, when --

dialogues.speaker: THE MAN
dialogues.text: punches through the passenger side window with his gloved hand. Lunges for David.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: leaps to the driver’s seat. Opens the door. Is about to escape when --

dialogues.speaker: THE MAN
dialogues.text: unlocks the passenger side door. Violently swings it open Catches hold of David by the neck. Yanks him out of the c in a single pull. His strength is impossible.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: falls from the car, landing hard on the cold concrete wit wind-stealing thud. Emily’s cell phone falls from his han and slides well out of reach.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: jumps out of the vestibule, keeping one hand on the open door.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: David

dialogues.speaker: THE MAN
dialogues.text: looks over at Corey, momentarily turning his attention aw from David.  47.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: uses this distraction to climb back into the car. The already open driver’s side door is his only chance. He frantically scurries across the front seat.

dialogues.speaker: THE MAN
dialogues.text: reaches in the car after David. Gets a hold of his shirt. Pulls hard.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: sheds his ripping dress shirt, leaving him in a T-shirt a freeing himself from the Man’s powerful grip. He falls ou of the driver’s side door. Struggles to get to his feet - he’s banged-up pretty badly.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: reaches his hand out, trying to hurry David along.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: Hurry!! Emily joins Cory outside the vestibule door.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: David, run!!!

dialogues.speaker: THE MAN
dialogues.text: walks to the front of the car. Closes in on David.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: staggers toward the vestibule. Notices the cell phone. 91 shines brightly on the display, waiting for the Send butt to be pressed.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: Hurry!! David stops. He’s about to change course and go for the phone.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: David -- no!!

dialogues.speaker: THE MAN
dialogues.text: gets to within eight feet of David. Five feet...  48. Three feet... He’s right on him... He’s just about to grab him, when...

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: is forced to abandon the phone. He changes his course bac toward the vestibule. He outstretches his hand, fighting through the pain. Just as the Man is about to latch onto him --

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: leans forward and connects with David’s hand. He YANKS Da in. Hard. Pulling him...

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE VESTIBULE
dialogues.text: Corey and Emily SLAM the door shut and hold it closed. Gr the handle with all their might. David falls to the floor, holding his ribs. Coughing. Bleeding. After a moment of obvious surprise, Emily and Corey relea their grip on the door. WE SEE that the Man has discontinued his pursuit. Just ov ten feet from the vestibule door. Emily drops to her knees, next to David. Comes to his aid Takes off her jacket and wraps David in it, leaving her i thin blouse.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: David! David! Are you okay? David labors to get his breath back. Corey watches as the Man walks away from the vestibule, i the darkness. Once Corey knows it’s safe, he joins Emily David's side.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: You all right? David coughs. His breath clouds in the cold air. He struggles to regain his faculties.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Yeah...  49. David hands Emily back her jacket.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Here.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: You need it.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: So do you.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE VESTIBULE
dialogues.text: The Man picks up Emily’s cell phone. He then walks over t the discarded deposit envelope. Picks that up as well.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE VESTIBULE
dialogues.text: They watch as the Man approaches David’s car. Circles aro to the trunk.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: What’s he doing?

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE VESTIBULE
dialogues.text: The Man reaches into his jacket pocket and removes Robert wallet. Tosses it inside the trunk. He then throws the deposit envelope and Emily’s cell phon into the trunk. 911 on the phone’s display screen, still having never been Sent. He SLAMS the trunk shut.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE VESTIBULE
dialogues.text: They watch the Man.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: (exasperated) Shit... Corey leans against the glass. Slides down to the floor. Mentally and physically spent. David and Emily are already seated on the floor. They, to have reached their limits. The three of them look at one another from across the vestibule. Shiver uncontrollably. Their faces ashen with grief. No one seems to know what to say. Silence is appropriate.  50. Emily stuffs her hands into her jacket pockets for warmth Finds something -- her tube of lipstick. She uncaps it an approaches the window. Writes something on the glass. David and Corey watch her.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE VESTIBULE
dialogues.text: The dim emergency lights appear bright when set against t dark night. Written in large, lipstick letters on the glass: “HELP”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INSERT - P.O.V. from the silent, black and white security camera in the ATM: David and Corey PULL on the small metal grate covering th heating vent. KICK at it. Emily watches with hope. Her lipstick message falls just outside the camera’s line sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try as David and Corey might, the metal grate’s not budgi Not a chance. They give up.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Son of a bitch. Their speech has begun to thicken. They exhibit signs of cognitive decline. Shiver uncontrollably. Appear slightly confused. Early signs of hypothermia. David looks closer at the vent. Examines it. Stares insid with a mini key ring flashlight.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: What do you see?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: There’s a...a room or something.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: A room? David blows into his numb hands in efforts to warm them.  51.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Yeah. It’s small. It must be where they go to restock the ATM.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: If there’s a room, that means there’s a door. Corey kneels down next to him. Looks inside the small ven

dialogues.speaker: COREY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If we distract him, Emily can use it to sneak out back.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: (re: the vent) There’s no way she’s fitting through this. David's right. The vent is far too small. Corey looks up at the cracks and dents made earlier in th plaster wall. Digs his fingers in. Pulls. His tired, frozen muscles keep him from mustering up any real streng Finally, a sizeable chunk of drywall falls to the floor, exposing a brick wall behind it.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: Son of a bitch. Emily looks over at the ATM.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: (to David) Let me see your card.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I took out as much as I could.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: I know. Her hand stays outstretched. David hands it to her. She inserts it into the ATM card slot. Looks to David. It takes him a second to realize what she’s waiting for.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Five, nine, oh-eight. Emily removes a pen from her coat pocket. Says the PIN ou loud as she writes it on the back of a deposit envelope.  52.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: Five...nine...zero...eight. Okay... She presses numbers on the ATM keypad. In reverse order o what she wrote down.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: Eight...zero...

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: You're doing it backwards.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: I know. I remember hearing that if you enter a pin backwards into an ATM, it automatically alerts the police. It’s some sort of panic code in case you're getting robbed. David joins Emily at the ATM. Corey stays down near the heating vent, shining the mini key ring flashlight inside

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: That’s an urban legend. It’s bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: (to Corey) How do you know that? Corey turns off the flashlight. Stuffs the keys in his pa pocket.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: Think about it -- what if your pin was, like, four, two, two, four? You're fucked.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: It’s still worth trying. Emily enters the last of the digits. Presses ENTER. The display screen reads: “INCORRECT PIN.” David’s card i ejected from the card slot. A steady BEEP sounds from the ATM, alerting them to remove the card. David is about to retrieve his card when he is distracted Corey, who climbs to his feet, facing the door.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: Where did he go?  53. David and Emily turn around to see what Corey is looking No one. The Man is missing. Robert's body, however, remai where it was last seen.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Did you see him leave?

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: I just turned around and he wasn’t there anymore.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: But did you actually see him walk away? David presses his face against the glass. His dilated eye frenetically dart in every direction. The ATM continues to beep, signaling the need for the car be retrieved from the slot.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: Who cares? This might be our only chance.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: He could be right around back.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: Even if he is, we’re less safe in here than we are out there.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: We're still alive. (re: Robert) He’s not.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: That doesn’t mean shit. Corey puts his hands on the door, prepared to exit.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: Corey, please, no. He stops. Disarmed by Emily’s genuine concern for him.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Please... He takes his hands off the door. Calms down. After a beat:  54.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: If he wants to get in here, he can.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: He doesn’t know that.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: He doesn’t have to use the door. He can smash the glass with a rock. He can drive the damn car right at us...

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: Then why hasn’t he?

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: I don’t know. I don’t know... The ATM finally stops beeping. David’s card is swallowed. David taps a few buttons on the ATM. Nothing. His card is gone.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Shit... Emily continues to stare out the windows. With her eyes fixed outside:

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: Why's he doing this to us?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I don’t know.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: Maybe we did something to him. But what? David obviously has no idea.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Did something happen at the bar?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Not with me.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: Me either. (beat, then to David) Wait...what about that guy from work today?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: What guy?  55.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: The one screaming at you on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: What did you do to him?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: Bullshit, nothing. You lost half the money in his 401K three days before Christmas.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Yeah, I know, but... (re: the Man) This guy isn’t him.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: How do you know?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Because I know.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: You said it yourself. You’ve never met him in person.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: No, but I do know he’s in his sixties. If anything, this guy could be any one of the thousands of people you piss off daily. Emily’s not convinced.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Emily, this guy isn’t doing all this because I lost his money. If that were the case, why would he kill the dog guy? It doesn’t make sense.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: It’s at least a reason.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: But why here? Why not do this in some alley or wherever, where there isn’t glass separating us, or a security camera watching?  56. David looks around the vestibule. Thinks as he speaks.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: It’s isolated. Open all night. Only one way in or out. And there’s a box full of money in it. (beat) It’s the perfect human trap.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: Human trap! Are you hearing yourself right now? David shrugs, any other ideas?

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: So what, he was waiting here?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I don’t know. It’s possible, maybe.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: He couldn’t have followed us. We didn’t see any cars.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Right, yes. So he was waiting.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: But how did he know we'd be here?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: He didn’t. Corey shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: Fuck that, this is all bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: (sarcastic) That’s great man. Really fucking insightful. They all try to calm their nerves a bit. None of them can stop from shivering. The cold is oppressive. After a long beat:

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: I can’t feel my fingers.  57.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: Me either. Emily extends her pale hands to get a better look at them Her fingertips are slightly purple. David cups Emily’s hands in his. Rubs them. In a much needed moment of levity, David grabs Corey’s ha too. Huddles them together with his and Emily's. But, the moment is fleeting. Somber looks soon appear on their faces. Their trembling hands lower and separate. Their eyes divert. They're freezing to death. They clearly know it, too. Just then, a faint light shines across the parking lot, n the supermarket. David, Corey and Emily turn to face it.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: What’s that? Seconds later, its source appears: the same car from earl Unlit emergency lights sit on its roof.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: It’s the police. The same one from before. Emily bangs against the class.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Help!! HELP US!! David and Corey join in, basically yelling the same.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A slightly overweight SECURITY GUARD, 45, drives his car through the parking lot. A late-night AM talk show plays his radio. He notices David, Emily and Corey across the parking lot the bank vestibule. Confounded, he circles around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INSERT - The Man's P.O.V.: the car approaches. He watches from the shadows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Security car pulls up closer to the vestibule.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE VESTIBULE
dialogues.text: They watch as the car draws nearer. Corey is ready to burst out the door. Emily and David sta behind him, also ready.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: As soon as the cop sees us, we make a run for it.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Yeah. Okay. But then -- the car’s overhead emergency lights are switc on. Not red and blue. Green. Corey stops. Apparently thinks better of exiting.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: It’s a security guard.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: So what? The Security car parks. Its green lights continue to spin From out of it emerges the Security Guard.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: So he doesn’t have a gun. He’s not going to be able to do shit to stop that guy.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: (re: the Man) Where is he?

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: I don’t know. I still don’t see him. Emily bangs on the glass.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: Help us!!

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE VESTIBULE
dialogues.text: The Security Guard walks toward the vestibule. Cautiously The spinning green light reflects off his shiny, brass ba  59. He notices the residue of the word “HELP” written on the glass, which is now faded and indiscernible. He removes a MAGLITE FLASHLIGHT from his garrison belt, n to a can of PEPPER SPRAY.

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY GUARD
dialogues.text: What are you guys doing in there? Muffled through the glass:

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Watch out -- there’s someone out there. Emily opens the door enough to lean outside. The Midwestern wind howls madly.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: Call the police! The Security Guard cannot hear her over the wind.

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY GUARD
dialogues.text: What? I can’t... He walks closer. Trepidation in each step. SECURITY GUARD (CONT’D) Are you okay in there? Still fighting the wind, but more discernible:

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: (pointing) He’s trying to kill us!! The Security Guard looks over to where Emily points. All sees is David’s car. Confused at first, the Security Guard’s expression quickl changes upon seeing Robert’s bloody, dead body lying on t concrete.

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY GUARD
dialogues.text: Jesus... He fumbles with his walkie-talkie. Hurriedly puts it to h mouth.

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY GUARD
dialogues.text: Twenty-two to base, twenty-two to base...  60. Only STATIC is heard from the other end of the walkie-tal SECURITY GUARD (CONT’D) Twenty-two to base, twenty-two to base... A DISPATCHER is heard through the walkie-talkie.

dialogues.speaker: DISPATCHER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Go ahead, twenty-two.

dialogues.speaker: WHAM
dialogues.text: The Security Guard's head is smashed with a half crumbled CINDER BLOCK. He collapses to the ground. The Man stands him. Seeing this, Emily YANKS the vestibule door shut. The Security Guard is almost unconscious. The man picks u smaller piece of the now shattered cinder block and SMASH SMASH. The man slams him in the temple. Blood spills out. Just as suddenly as it started, it stops. The Security Gu doesn’t move. The Man takes a step away, over to the Security car. He turns off the ignition, the lights. The Man then grabs the Security Guard by his shirt. Drags him, using only one of his powerful arms, across the park lot. Like he’s clearing roadkill.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE VESTIBULE
dialogues.text: David, Emily and Corey watch as the Man drags the Securit Guard’s dead, bloodied body closer to David's car. He lea him there, carelessly, not far from Robert’s carcass. It’s all too much for Emily to take. She walks softly to the corner of the booth. Sits down. H back facing David and Corey. After a beat:

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Are you okay? Emily? She doesn’t answer.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: Emily?  61.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: Leave me alone. David reaches out to touch Emily’s shoulder. She abruptly pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: Both of you, please, just...leave me alone. She shivers in the cold. Hugs her arms close to her body. David and Corey speak quietly to each other.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: She needs to keep moving.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I know, I know...

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: We should still make a run for it --

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: (overlapping) No --

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: -- He'll go for one of us, and the others can make a run for it.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Who's going to play the bait? You? Because I’m sure as hell not going to again. Corey sighs. Frustrated. Still huddled in the corner:

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: Do we have any more plants?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: (confused) What?

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
