dialogues.text: Plants...I don’t know. I thought there were plants. She rubs her temples. Appears disconcerted.  62.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: (quietly to David) She's disoriented as fuck.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: It’s hypothermia. We can’t stay here much longer.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: No shit. We just have -- CLICK. A HOWLING wind blows into the vestibule. Their heads WHIP around to face the now open door, where see --

dialogues.speaker: -- THE MAN WALKING IN
dialogues.text: Corey's eyes widen.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Emily!! David LUNGES forward, BLOCKING the Man from Emily, who he nearest. He GRABS the Man by his thick jacket and SLAMS h against the plaster wall.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: Abhh.. The Man FIGHTS BACK. Resists. Corey immediately JUMPS in the fray. Joins David in WRESTLING the Man to the ground. WHACK-WHACK-WHACK! David and Corey’s PUNCHES land, haphazardly, all over the Man’s face and body. Still he continues to struggle, both audibly and physically. The Man KICKS wildly, STRIKING Corey in the face. Emily screams.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Grab him!! Corey shakes it off. Blood spills from his nose. He JUMPS back on top of the Man, rejoining David in the struggle. GRABS the Man by the hair, lifts his head -- -- SLAM-SLAM-SLAM. Against the wall, just beneath the signing shelf. The Man screams out in pain. Blood stains his hair. Still, he fights back. Grabs at David’s face an neck.  63.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: David!! The Man’s fingers RAKE across David's eyes. PULL at his h and skin. The entire battle is awkwardly primordial. No skill whatsoever; only pure survival instinct. With the Man’s hands now GRABBING at his throat, David notices the pen -- hanging from a thin, steel cable wire attached to the signing shelf above -- dangling in front him. His eyes widen. He frees one of his hands, which is tangled up in the struggle. Grabs the pen. Wraps the steel wire around the Man's throat. Takes hold of the wire with both hands -- -- and PULLS with all his might. Pushing off with his fee for leverage, against the Man’s body. The Man’s hands instantly raise to his throat. He writhes and thrashes like a fish on a boat deck. Desperately trie to squeeze his fingers beneath the wire. His face turns color. Red first, then blue. The veins in his forehead and neck look as if they are about to burst. David bares his clenched teeth, holding on with all his strength. The Man’s legs kick uncontrollably, more and more...until -- he succumbs to asphyxiation. He stops moving. His head slowly slumps to his chest. It’s over. Corey inches away from the body. Equally unnerved, David pushes the Man’s dead, bloodied body off of him, onto the floor. INSERT - The P.O.V. from the black and white security cam in the ATM: David slides out from underneath the Man. Lets go of the signing shelf pen cord, wrapped around the Man’s throat. slips off the Man. Dangles from the signing shelf. Corey and Emily stare. David looks up at them.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: Is he...? Still laboring to catch his breath, David responds with a uneasy nod. Corey lets out a long sigh. His lungs are also on fire fr the encounter. He takes off his collared dress shirt, leaving him in a T-shirt. He holds the collared shirt to bloody nose.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What...what do we do now?

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: Leave. David nods in agreement, still somewhat shell-shocked.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: We have to tell the police.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Yeah. We will. Let’s just get out of here first. David climbs to his feet. Corey does the same.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to Emily) You okay?

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: Yeah. Are you?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I think so. (to Corey) How's your nose. Corey doesn’t answer. He slowly lowers the shirt from his nose. His dilated eyes stare straight ahead.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to Corey) Hey...? You all right?

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: No... David looks at Emily. She also stares outside. David turn to see what they’re looking at.  65. To his shock, he sees the Man. Standing twenty feet from entrance. Watching them.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: What...? How’s he...?

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: What did you do?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I didn’t do anything. He...he was going to kill us!

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: (re: the dead body) Who is he? If it’s not him, then who is it?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I don’t know. I thought...you did, too.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: I know, I know! David is thunderstruck. He places his hand against the wa to steady himself. Emily takes steps away, overcome by emotion. After a beat, Corey takes off the dead man’s parka. Its h -- which was on the dead man’s head when he first entered vestibule -- has since fallen off, exposing his bloody fa Underneath the parka, the dead man wears a work uniform o some kind. A factory-style jumpsuit. A plastic employee badge for “NEWGATE HOSPITAL” -- with his photo, name and “CUSTODIAL DEPT. - 3RD SHIFT” printed on it -- is clipped his breast pocket. Corey searches through the parka pockets. He only finds useless pieces of paper. He then starts a search of the d man’s pants pockets.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: Looking for a cell phone. Corey continues his frantic search. From the dead man’s pockets, he removes: Set of keys...  66. Small bits of paper... And a wallet. But no cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: COREY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Nothing. Corey resignedly tosses the items to the cold, tile floor Emily notices an ATM card lying on the floor. David grabs the dead man’s discarded wallet off the floor Sifts through its contents: A credit card... Very little cash... A small photo of him, along with a woman of about the sam age and two adolescent children... His license...

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: (reading) Harold Westbrook. Eight Frederick Street. Date of birth: five, nineteen, sixty-eight. (beat) What the hell was he doing here?

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: Using the ATM. David looks over to see Emily holding Harold’s ATM card. David leans back against the frosty glass. Sits down. His head falls into his trembling hands.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: We don’t know anything about this guy. For all we know, he could've been working with that douchebag outside.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: He’s got a wife...kids.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: So what? That could all be bullshit.  67.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: For Christ's sake, Corey, the guy’s a fucking janitor. He was on his way to work. Emily places the ATM card on the floor and moves back.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: He’s innocent... (sotto, but loud enough for them to hear) Just like we are. Corey and David are quickly sobered by this statement. A moments of silence pass before David breaks it.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: (re: Harold, dejected) Not anymore. David looks at Emily. His guilt is palpable. Corey can’t fight it anymore. He knows they’re right. He kicks over the metal waste basket. Paper flies everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE VESTIBULE
dialogues.text: The Man watches them for a moment. Studies them. After a beat, he moves into the shadows.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE VESTIBULE
dialogues.text: Emily returns to the opposite side of the vestibule. Davi remains seated against the glass, his arms huddled to his chest. Corey walks over to Harold’s body and takes the pa off him. Seeing Harold’s bloody, dead body makes Emily uneasy. She looks away. Corey puts the heavy parka on over his T-shirt. Walks to other end of the vestibule. Leans against the glass. It’s apparent they all need some space from one another. No one says a word at first. And then, after a long beat:

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: You had to make me stop. You couldn't just go home...  68.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: Fuck you, David. Don’t even try make this my fault.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: It is your fault!

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE VESTIBULE
dialogues.text: The Man walks to the rear of the vestibule. David and Corey continue to argue OFF-SCREEN. Their voice though slightly silenced by the walls, still carry throug enough to be heard.

dialogues.speaker: COREY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Nobody made you stop.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: You did! The Man flips open the toolbox. Grabs the spool of metal wire.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE VESTIBULE
dialogues.text: The argument continues.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: I didn’t make you do anything. You could've said no.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I did say no. Twice. But as usual, you didn’t give a shit.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: That still doesn’t make this my fault. If it’s anyone’s fault, it’s yours.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Mine? David leaps to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: Get the fuck out of my face.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Fuck you.  69.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: (re: Harold ) You're the one who did this... With that, David immediately charges at Corey. INSERT - The P.O.V. from the silent, black and white came inside the ATM: David slams Corey hard into the plaster wall. Corey stand back, momentarily shocked. He appears to shout something then charges back at David.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Corey tries to tackle David, but David holds his ground. Emily attempts to break it up.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: Stop! Stop it! David pushes Corey back against the wall. Corey responds SHOVING David hard to his chest.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: (to Corey) You did it, too!

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: Get off me!

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE VESTIBULE
dialogues.text: The Man watches from the shadows, not far from David’s ca Corey and David continue to push and shove each other.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE VESTIBULE
dialogues.text: David and Corey, still tangled up, have clearly begun to tire. Their arms soon unlock. Release their grip on each other, breaking the stalemate. They each let out long sighs, which curl from their mouth spirals of cold mist. They walk away from each other. Emily looks outside.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: He’s gone again.  70. David doesn’t bother to look. Neither does Corey. Their disdainful gazes are locked on each other.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: He’s out there. Somewhere. It’s clear that Corey’s reached a breaking point.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: I'm tired of this shit. I’m tired of hiding. Tired of waiting for someone to come save me.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: It’s the only option we have.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: You have. Corey grabs his bottle of tequila. Takes a swig.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: What are you going to do?

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: Get the hell out of here.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: That’s what he wants you to do --

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: -- Fuck him! He’s one guy! There are three of us.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: I can’t go out there, Corey.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: Don't. (to David) You either. (to both) I don’t even care anymore. If you want to stay in here and die, that’s your call. But I’m done with this. Corey places his bottle of Tequila on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: Please, just wait...

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: No. No more waiting.  71.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Enough with the tough guy rou -- Wait...what?!!  Corey’s BURSTS out of the vestibule door!

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Corey, no!!

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE VESTIBULE
dialogues.text: Corey stops for a brief moment, not far from the door. Sc the parking lot. To the left...to the right. It’s empty - the Man is nowhere to be found. David and Emily bang against the glass, trying to get Cor to return. Corey disregards their pleas. He steels himself -- and then RACES into the darkened lot His legs pump hard despite being nearly locked up from th cold. His heart drums wildly. Just as he is about to pass by David's car -- -- WHAM!! His legs inexplicably come out from under him, landing him flat on his back. Hard. The bone in his left leg BREAKS.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE VESTIBULE
dialogues.text: David and Emily watch. Panicked.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: Corey!

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE VESTIBULE
dialogues.text: Corey lies on the ground, in agonizing pain. He coughs, gasps for breath. Holds his throat. Still, he tries to drag himself to safety. Just then, the Man approaches him, arriving from out of t darkness. Traces something in the air -- a straight line some kind. WE SEE what it is he traces: the metal wire -- strung acr the clearing between the car and the pole of an overhead light.  72. He created a perimeter. The Man hovers over Corey. Corey’s gaze climbs him, until finally stares at the Man’s shrouded face. Deep, cloudy breaths emanate from underneath his hood.

dialogues.speaker: COREY
dialogues.text: Please...please...

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE VESTIBULE
dialogues.text: David bangs against the glass. Pleads for his friend’s li

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: No!! Nol!!! The Man looks over at David and Emily. He calmly pulls ou SCREWDRIVER from inside his parka. David's eyes widen as he sees the screwdriver. He tries t exit the vestibule to help his friend, but Emily grabs ho of him. She hangs on with all her might.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No!! Corey!!!

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: David, no!

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Let me go!!

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: It’s too late!

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: No it’s not! Let me go! David opens the door and pushes free of Emily. Harder tha he probably intended. She falls backward, tripping over Harold’s legs and SLAMMING her head onto the cold floor. Seeing this, David stops. Closes the door and rushes to h side.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Shit! I’m sorry! Emily...!

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: I'm okay. I’m all right. She rubs the back of her head.  73. Seeing that she’s okay, David starts to turn away. Emily grabs him by the arm with surprising force, stopping him.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don’t look. Emily's fearful pleas give David pause. But, David has to look. He slowly turns to face the vestibule door. Outside, he s Corey's dead, bloody body lying on the cold concrete. The screwdriver still sticking from his stomach. David's hands tremble. His breathing borders on hyperventilation. Nearing a breakdown, David's feet move backwards. Slowly. Further and further away from the door. His back soon touches the plaster wall. Collapses onto it

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: This can’t...this can’t be happening... He rubs at his eyes, his temples. His hands wring his mus hair. His whole body shakes. He falls apart. Emily waits a moment before approaching him. Sits down ne to him. She holds him; he holds her. They shiver in the unyielding cold.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE VESTIBULE
dialogues.text: The Man walks behind the vestibule. Picks up the hammer a screwdriver. He's just about to SMASH the metal door, whe he’s distracted by a distant sound. Turning to see what caused it, he notices that yet anothe Christmas tree has blown over near the supermarket. It pu against a metal chain, which keeps it from completely blo away. He is about to return his attention to the vestibule, but does a double-take when he sees -- -- the long, frozen, industrial hose snaked between the r of Christmas trees.  74. He takes a beat. The vapor of misty breath stops coming f under his parka hood. The world seems still, quiet. As if providing him with the silence he needs to think. Then, a sudden release of breath escapes his mouth as he marches over to the row of Christmas trees. He grabs the industrial hose. Pulls. It cracks and creaks as the ice inside and around it breaks up.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE VESTIBULE
dialogues.text: David and Emily huddle close together for warmth. It does little to keep their bodies from freezing.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: The hat...I knew it wasn’t yours. I grabbed it off the back of someone’s chair.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: (shrugs ) I was desperate.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: For what?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: For a way to keep you from leaving. (beat) I wish I had just let you go. I’m so sorry.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: Don’t be.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: You should be home right now.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: David...

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: It’s my fault. An unsettling realization occurs to Emily.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: You're right. It is.  75. David looks at Emily. Surprised by her concurrence.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It’s all of our fault. Emily sets adrift in thought.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We've been in here for hours now trying to control what’s happening to us. Waiting for...a reason. (beat) What, because we didn’t do anything wrong we’re somehow supposed to be protected? By who? The police? Alarms? Little visor clips with angels on them? (beat) If there is a reason this is happening, it’s because we never thought it could. David takes a moment to consider this.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Still, you shouldn't be here.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: I could have taken a cab. I could have skipped the party. I could have never worked at Starkweather in the first place. But, I did all those things, and a million, random things in between, and added up they all brought me here tonight...with you. David looks up at Emily.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Although, given what’s happened, lunch would have probably been a better choice. David ekes out a smile. He pulls Emily closer. They tight their embrace.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I’ve wanted to be this close to you for so long. Emily's head falls to David’s chest, against his T-shirt. Her chin slowly rises.  76. Tears trickle over her lips as they draw nearer to David' And then, suddenly --

dialogues.speaker: BANG
dialogues.text: David and Emily LEAP to their feet. Turn to face the plas wall.

dialogues.speaker: BANG-BANG-BANG-BANG
dialogues.text: Followed by silence. David and Emily stare at the plaster wall. Like deer in headlights. Waiting for whatever could possibly happen ne And then, the distinct sound of old, rusted hinges squeal as a hulking metal door is forced open. David and Emily listen intently.

dialogues.speaker: DUN.....--- DUN.......- DUN......--
dialogues.text: The Man’s heavy footsteps trace along the opposite side o the plaster wall. A faint clinking sound is heard, coming from the heating vent. Metal touching metal. But just as suddenly as it started, it stops. Silence. Emily and David don’t move a muscle. They wait. David's attention is suddenly stolen by something he sees of the corner of his eye. David turns around fully to get a better look. His visage of bewilderment is instantly replaced by that shock.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Christ... Emily turns to see what David is looking at. It’s Corey. He’s ash-white. Bleeding profusely. The screwdriver still stuck in his stomach. Corey's quivering arms drag himself across the parking lo toward the ATM vestibule. A trail of smeared blood follow him. Emily is about to say something -- or scream -- when Davi pulls her close to him. Covers her mouth.  77. Puts a finger to his mouth. Shhhhhhhh. A cloud of smoke accentuates his silent directive. He points at the plaster wall, referring to the Man. Emil gets it -- she nods. David removes his hand from her mouth. David quietly opens the vestibule door. Exits. Emily exit with him to...

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE VESTIBULE
dialogues.text: They are instantly hit with an achingly cold gust of wind In the background, WE SEE the time and temperature sign. Current time: 3:léam. Temperature: negative 6 degrees Fahrenheit. David and Emily sneak across the parking lot. Hurry over Corey. Grab him under the arms. Lift the upper part of hi body off the ground. For a moment they consider whether to make a run for it i the other direction. But it’s impossible. They have to ge Corey back inside.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: (hushed) Okay. Come on. They move Corey back toward the vestibule, trying not to a sound. His rag doll legs noisily drag across the ground

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (hushed) Hurry... They continue to drag Corey. Blood spills from his open wound. They’re halfway there, when --

dialogues.speaker: THE MAN
dialogues.text: appears from out of the shadows. He moves toward them. Faster than usual.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID AND EMILY
dialogues.text: see the Man. They panic.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: There he is!!  78.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Go-go-go!! They pull with all their might, as fast as their frozen, fatigued bodies will allow.

dialogues.speaker: THE MAN
dialogues.text: closes the distance between them. He holds the tire iron his hand.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID AND EMILY
dialogues.text: pull Corey with all their collective might. David’s legs tangled with Corey’s. He stumbles.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: Get up! He’s coming!! David quickly gets back to his feet. They resume their rescue effort.

dialogues.speaker: THE MAN
dialogues.text: gets dangerously close. Within twenty feet. Fifteen feet. Ten feet...

dialogues.speaker: DAVID AND EMILY
dialogues.text: call upon every last bit of strength they possess.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Get the door!! I’ve got him -- get the door!!

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: lets go of Corey. Rushes over to the vestibule.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: grabs Corey under both arms from behind. Lifts him a bit higher off the ground than he previously had been. Corey lets out a pained groan.

dialogues.speaker: THE MAN
dialogues.text: sees Emily rushing for the vestibule. He chooses to stay David. He’s close. Very close.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: opens the door. Rushes inside. Holds the door open with a outstretched arm.  79.

dialogues.speaker: THE MAN
dialogues.text: raises the tire iron as he gets within striking distance David.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: David! Hurry!!

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: gives Corey one final, desperate pull, dragging him...

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE VESTIBULE
dialogues.text: Emily helps pull David in, as he still carries Corey. Emi SLAMS the door shut. INSERT - The P.O.V. from the black and white security cam in the ATM: David falls into the vestibule, on top of Corey, after dragging his body in there. David drags and leans Corey against one of the windows. David's body blocks much of what is going on with Corey.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE VESTIBULE
dialogues.text: The Man stands outside the vestibule. Just over ten feet away from the entrance. Still holding the tire iron. He stares at Emily, who remains standing at the door. Transfixed. After a beat, the Man lowers the tire iron to his side.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE VESTIBULE
dialogues.text: Emily stares back at the Man. Terrified.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Emily, what are you doing?! I need your help! Emily snaps out of it. Slowly. Still staring at the Man. After a beat, she joins David, who attends to Corey. Corey’s in worse condition than it seemed. His skin is terribly pale. His purple lips tremble.  80. Blood leaks from his stomach, through his flimsy T-shirt all over Harold's parka, which he still wears.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: (to Corey) Holy shit, holy shit. Corey? Corey? Can you hear me? Come on, buddy...please...Corey? Corey?! (to Emily) We've got to get him help.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: Cover his stomach with something.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: With what?

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: Anything!

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I don’t have -- give me something! Emily looks around. Grabs a handful of deposit envelopes. Hands them to David.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: (re: the envelopes) Use these. David places them against Corey’s wound, carefully avoidi the screwdriver. Blood immediately soaks through the pape The pressure causes Corey to emit an anguished scream. He doubles over.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE VESTIBULE
dialogues.text: The Man leans in the smashed passenger side window of Dav car. Shifts it into NEUTRAL.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE VESTIBULE
dialogues.text: Corey’s condition worsens by the second.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: What do I do?!

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: I don’t know! Corey shivers uncontrollably. He’s freezing. Bleeding to death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus...Corey.... To Emily, regarding the screwdriver:

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Should I pull it out?

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: No. It could make it worse.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: (re: the blood) It’s not stopping!

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: I know, I know... Emily places Corey’s discarded button-down shirt -- which previously left in the vestibule after using it to blot h bloody nose -- over his stomach.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Do it easy.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: I have to put pressure on it! Emily presses the shirt down on Corey’s wound, trying to stabilize his bleeding. More blood oozes out. Corey responds weakly. It’s clear he’s fading fast. The blood soaks through the shirt, drenching it.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: We've got to get him to a hospital.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I don’t know, but we have to. He’s going to bleed to death if we don’t. Corey continues to shiver. Emily takes off her coat, leaving her in her work blouse. She drapes it over Corey like a blanket. Still aiding Corey, David looks outside for the Man. nowhere in sight.  82. David turns his attention back inside the vestibule. Frantically looks everywhere for an answer.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If we try to... David notices that Corey is starting to drift away. He gently taps his cheek to bring him back.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to Corey) ...whoa-whoa-whoa, Corey...Corey! Corey comes back around, albeit slightly.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (re: the compress) Keep holding that there. David climbs to his feet. Nervously searches the vestibul

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: What are you doing? David picks up the metal waste basket. Takes firm hold of it. Without even a moment of hesitation -- WHACK! WHACK! WHACK! David slams the waste basket against the ATM. INSERT - P.O.V. from the black and white security camera the ATM: The round base of the metal waste basket comes into frame it’s continuously SMASHED against the ATM. After yet another SMASH with the waste basket, the image ATM security camera goes dead.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: The ATM display screen is shattered. There is no longer a image -- only a dead, broken monitor. David looks up to the emergency lights with hope in his expectant eyes. Still, no alarm.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: What are you doing?!  83.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: It’ll send a signal to the police, won't it? If the ATM’s broken?

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: I don’t know!

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Well, something in this thing has to! It’s owned by a God damn bank! Still tending to the rapidly fading Corey, Emily glances outside. Her mouth falls agape. David turns and sees why. The Man has rolled David’s car up against the front of th vestibule. The front bumper presses against the glass doo

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What...? David tries to open the vestibule door. Not a chance. He frantically tries again. It barely opens an inch.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We're locked in. Corey suddenly starts to convulse.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: (re: Corey) What’s he doing?! David rushes over to help. Grabs Corey’s shaking legs.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Grab him! Emily struggles to Keep Corey’s body under control. Blood and bile spill from the corner of his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Corey! Come on, buddy. Please... Corey soon stops. He’s alive. Barely. His blood soaks David's clothes. David is paralyzed by his inability to do a damn thing to the situation. And then -- THERE'S WATER. It rushes through the heating vent. Fast.  84.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Holy shit! The icy water rapidly spreads across the floor. Pools in corners.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: Stop it! David stuffs Corey’s discarded, bloody shirt into the met grate covering the vent. It does little to stop the heavy flow of water. He winces in pain as the cold water stings his shivering, purple hands. The water splashes all over him, soaking hi clothes. An inch of water has already filled the vestibule. Some leaks out from underneath the door and windows -- but not much.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: David, help me! Emily tries to lift Corey’s body from the water. David rushes over to help. They lift Corey’s body. He emi a pained moan.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: The signing shelf. Their feet splash through the frigid water as they strugg to carry Cory’s limp body over to the signing shelf.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: On three. One, two, three... They try to lift Corey high enough to lay him on the sign shelf, but can’t.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Higher!

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: I...I...can’t. Emily's bent fingers appear almost arthritic. The cold an wet is crippling. She shivers uncontrollably. David grabs Corey by himself. Lifts him. Places him on th shelf -- but it’s far too narrow. Corey slips right off.  85. David has no choice but to place him back on the ground, the water. It’s now close to six inches deep.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Fuck... Emily drapes her coat over Corey once again. David approaches the door. He tries to control his erratic, irrepressibly rapid breathing. His purple lips quiver.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: (re: the Man) He’s trying to drown us. David pushes the door with all his might. It opens an inch. Water drains -- but cold air rushes in. David's muscles give. The door closes.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Not drown us -- freeze us. The water is unremitting. Gallon after ice cold gallon spills from out of the vent, bringing the level in the vestibule just under David and Emily’s knees. Harold's corpse floats at the surface of the frigid water Holding Corey close, compressing his wound, David’s eyes frenetically dart in every direction, searching for a solution. And then, he sees something -- right in front of his face The focus of his rapt attention: a pack of cigarettes, po out of the inside pocket of Harold’s parka -- which is st being worn by Corey. David ferrets through the parka. Removes the pack of cigarettes. As he clearly hoped, a disposable lighter is also tucked away in the inside pocket. His look of hopelessness evaporates from his face, overco by an expression of nascent optimism. He then looks up at the ceiling, where he sees -- -- the FIRE SPRINKLER system, poking through various part the high ceiling. David hatches an instant plan. Potentially a good one.  86. He leaps to his feet. Climbs, with great difficulty, on t of the metal signing shelf. Tries sparking the lighter. H numb, purple hands lack the motor skills required to spin striker. He resolves to use the palm of his other hand to spin it. It only spits a few sparks. One more try. Finally, it catches. He holds the lighter over his head. But, the ceiling is far too high.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: shit!

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: You need to be higher.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I know, I know... Emily sits Corey up against the wall. She then collects a many paper items as she can that have not yet gotten wet. Deposit envelopes, discarded receipts, etc. Stuffs them in the metal waste basket, which now floats o the surface of the rising water.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: Find as much paper as you can. Anything that will burn. David joins Emily as they both work intensively at this t

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE VESTIBULE
dialogues.text: The Man sets up the folding lawn chair. Sits in it. Watch David and Emily from afar as they race to fill the waste basket.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE VESTIBULE
dialogues.text: The waste basket is fairly full.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: That’s enough. David holds out the lighter. Again he struggles to light Spark. Spark.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: (sotto) Come on, come on...  87. Spark. Spark.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come on! And then, finally -- -- and it catches. He uses his other hand to shield the flame as he moves the lighter closer to the paper in the waste basket. David touches the flame to the corner of a single piece o paper. The flames quickly spread. He stuffs the lighter into his pants pocket. Within a matter of seconds, large flames jump out from th top of the waste basket.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: All right -- hold onto it. Emily takes hold of the waste basket. Watches David as th ice cold water continues to rise. He places his knee on top of the signing shelf. Reaches t grab hold of anything that can assist him in his climb -- there’s nothing. Just a blank, glass wall. Inching forward onto his butt, he manages to sit on the narrow shelf. The next step is far more difficult: standi up. He checks the status of the fire inside the waste basket. Still burning, but already showing signs of weakening. He looks over at Corey, who sits against the wall. The water up to his chest. Time is running out -- for everyone.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Throw in more paper.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: There’s only a little left!

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Use it! Emily throws in the last of the paper. The fire reignites its original strength. She approaches the signing shelf.  88.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: Here -- grab onto my shoulders. David does just that. He’s able to maintain his balance l enough to stand up.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Okay...hand it to me. Ducking away from the flames, Emily lifts up the metal wa basket.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Careful...be careful.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: Take it...take it! David takes the waste basket. Emily takes several steps backward. Sloshes through the i cold water. David lifts the waste basket. Past his face. Over his hea His lower back inches away from the wall. He sways back a forth. His view of the fire sprinkler is blocked by the waste basket.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Am I near it? She shakes her head to offer a distressed “No.” David angles the waste basket so he can see for himself. He’s not even close. The ceiling is simply too high. He lets out a frustrated scream. Lowers the waste basket. Rests it on the signing shelf.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE VESTIBULE
dialogues.text: David's scream is dampened by the glass windows. The Man remains seated in the lawn chair. Patiently waiti He watches as Emily pushes against the door. It opens eno to let some water out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fire inside the waste basket is dying fast.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: We need more paper. Anything! Corey fades in and out of consciousness. His skin has tur an icy blue. The water level is up to his chin. Emily’s jacket, which previously draped over him like a blanket, now floats on of the water, as does his capped bottle of tequila. Emily tears cardboard Bank of the Midwest advertisements from behind their plastic shields, on the plaster wall. Hurries them over to David.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: Throw these in. David does just that. WOOSH -- the advertisements go up in flames. David angles away from the heat. But the flames quickly subside. Threaten to extinguish. Emily and David’s already raised panic increases.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Help me up. Emily starts climbing onto the signing table. She extends her hand for David to grab.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Help pull me up.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: No -- what are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: The fire’s going to burn out. David helps Emily onto the narrow signing shelf. The two them barely fit on top of it. The flaming waste basket doesn’t make it any easier. Emily takes hold of David's shoulder as she gets her bala Being smaller than David, she has less trouble standing u

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: What the hell are you --

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: Try to squat down a little.  90.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: The fire’s going out. We’re wasting time!

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: If I can get on your shoulders, I should be able to get close enough to the sprinklers.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: Just do it, David! Please! David squats down. Slightly. His back eases away from the wall. His balance is shaky. Emily places her foot on David's thigh. Carefully grabs around his neck. Tries to climb on top of him. With one hand still balancing the waste basket on the sig table, David uses the other to help Emily climb. Emily's foot slips off David’s thigh. She loses her balan but manages to stay on the signing shelf. Corey emits a pained moan, which instantly turns into a m spiral in the cold air.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Forget it! David grabs the other side of the waste basket. Ready to lift it again.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: Help me up again.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Forget it, Emily. It’s not working!

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: You can’t reach it by yourself! David reluctantly gives in. He squats lower, struggling t maintain his balance.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Lower...  gl.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: I can’t get any lower without falling off.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: Try! He manages to lower himself a few more inches. His legs s back and forth, threatening to cause him to fall at any moment. Emily again places her foot on David’s thigh... Grabs hold around his neck... Pulls herself up... Slowly raises her leg over his shoulder, followed by the other. She’s on. David wavers a bit, causing Emily to sway, but he manages hold fast. He slowly presses up with his legs. They did it. And not a minute too soon -- the fire is rapidly fading.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: Okay, pass it to me. David grips the waste basket. His knees shake a bit. His balance remains unsteady. He raises the flaming waste basket.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Okay, take it. The flames get rather close to Emily. Still, she reaches the waste basket.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: Almost... David extends his arms above his head as far as he can. Emily's hands lunge for the basket. She reaches further.. Further... And then finally --  92.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I've got it! David slowly releases the waste basket. Emily holds onto

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: All right, rise it above you. Under one of the sprinklers. Emily spots the closest sprinkler. It’s right above her. The top of David's feet dangle precariously off the edge the shelf. His hypothermic body sways back and forth. Emily's skinny, soaking wet arms struggle to raise the me waste basket over her head.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Higher!

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: I'm trying!! It inches up further. Almost close enough. Higher... Higher... Almost there... And then, as the flames lick against the sprinkler -- -- PSSSHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHH!! All of the sprinklers fire, raining down water inside the vestibule.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE VESTIBULE
dialogues.text: The Man watches from the shadows as a STROBE LIGHT flashe repeatedly from inside the vestibule. A separate strobe light flashes outside the vestibule. An audible ALARM sounds: WOOP...WOOP...WOOP...WOOP...

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE VESTIBULE
dialogues.text: Frigid water sprays all over Emily and David. The strobe light flashes ad nauseam. The alarm is deafening. But Emily and David rejoice.

dialogues.speaker: EMILY
dialogues.text: It worked! It wor --  93. The signing shelf gives on one side. Collapses. David's legs come right out from under him. He and Emily come CRASHING down. David SPLASHES into the waist-deep water that fills the vestibule. His back SLAMS against the floor below with a thud. Emily, falling from an even greater height, falls straigh down -- -- SMACK!! Her head SMASHES against the half of the signi shelf that did not collapse. She SPLASHES into the water. Clouds of crimson spill from her head, clouding the water which she now floats. In a great deal of pain, hypothermic, David emerges from water. Sees Emily lying motionless in the sanguine water.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Emily!! He rushes through the water to her. Lifts her in his arms Holds her close to him. Shivers uncontrollably.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (frantic) Oh my God. Emily! She barely stirs. Her eyes flutter. Bloody spit spills fr the corner of her mouth. She's alive. Hanging on by a thread. Gelid water also continues to rain down from the sprinkle causing the water level to rise twice as fast as before. The strobe light keeps its cadence, as does the audible a sound.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Please...just hold on. Help’s on the way. Hold on. Emily's almost completely unresponsive. She starts to sli away.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No-no-no...come back, come back.  94. Emily comes around, albeit ever so slightly. But only for moment. She and David look in each other’s eyes...and then... ...she’s gone. Crestfallen, David leans his head against the glass wall, hugging Emily close to him. He shivers madly, colder than ever.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: No... The ear-piercing sound of the alarm and the extremely bri strobe light are maddening. Holding Emily in his trembling arms, covered in her blood rapidly comes undone. He looks across the vestibule, at Corey, who, like Harold floats face-down on the surface of the water. Time has expired for him as well. David falls apart. The water from the sprinklers rains do on his defeated head. It’s over. But then --

dialogues.speaker: -- SMASH
dialogues.text: David's car CRASHES through the vestibule door, after hav been RAMMED by the Security Car. The vestibule’s glass walls SHATTER. Water RUSHES from the vestibule, into the parking lot, bringing Corey’s body with it. David lays on the floor of what remains of the vestibule. Injured. Disoriented. Bleeding. Freezing. He soon regains his faculties. Looks at the piled-up cars The destruction. The bodies. He crawls over to where Emily’s body now lay. Cradles her his tremulous arms. A single tear streaks down his pallid cheek. It clings to his clenched jaw before falling to the ground.  95. He looks outside the vestibule at the Man, who is back in view, seated -- to David’s confusion -- in the folding la chair. The Man doesn’t flinch. He just sits and watches. But then -- a change in David begins to occur. Angry tear escape his eyes. His teeth clench. His pulse races. His breathing becomes fast and guttural. Overcome by a blinding rage, he leans Emily’s lifeless bo against the wall. Sits her upright, against the badly damaged plaster wall. He tenderly brushes her hair from her pretty face as the achingly cold water continues to spray from the fire sprinklers above. Despite the extensive damage suffered by the vestibule, t emergency lights continue to strobe, interspersing flashe white light with moments of almost complete darkness... The fire alarm keeps its maddening cadence. David climbs to his feet. Walks, like a caged animal, acr the vestibule. His eyes lock on Corey’s half-full bottle tequila. He unscrews the cap... Reaches into his car through the smashed window. Removes jacket. Tears out the liner... Pours a small amount of the tequila onto the jacket liner Stuffs it into the bottle, letting a portion hang outside serve as a wick. A Molotov Cocktail. David then exits what’s left of the vestibule. Walks past the crashed security car. Sees that the gas peddle is wed to the floor with the tire iron. He approaches Corey’s drenched, dead body. He grabs hold of the screwdriver in Corey’s stomach, look away -- and YANKS it out. Seething, David again looks out at the Man, who still rem seated in the folding chair, partially shrouded by darkne David takes one last look at Emily. She leans against the plaster wall, where he left her.  96. Tragically beautiful. This galvanizing image brings David to his breaking point The temperature is crippling. His drenched clothes cling his enfeebled frame. Still, David soldiers on. He holds the Molotov Cocktail at the ready. The screwdriv in the other hand. He removes the lighter from his pocket. It lights on the first try. He touches the flame to the alcohol-soaked jac liner. It catches. Covered in blood, and with a look of unbridled hostility his face, David looks every bit the animal his captivity caused him to become. The alarm sounds loudly... The strobe light continues to flash, outside and inside t vestibule... The green security lights spin atop the security car as s emanates from under its damaged hood... The night’s madness has reached its crescendo.. David moves in closer, the screwdriver outstretched befor him. Every step he takes gathers more purpose. Incredibly, the Man still does not move from the chair. H sits, hidden in the shadows, watching as David draws near David is now approaching with considerable speed. Without breaking his stride, he takes a quick look at the Molotov Cocktail. It’s more than ready.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: (reaching his arm back) Burn, you son of a bitch. With that, David throws the bottle down hard from less th ten feet away. -- BOOOOSH!! It crashes directly in front of the Man, instantly engulfing him in flames. A somewhat sadistic, satisfied smile grin crosses David's face.  97.

dialogues.speaker: BURN
dialogues.text: But then, his savage elation slowly fades away, replaced look of grave concern. To David's amazement -- and horror -- the Man doesn't mov inch, despite being burned alive. The flames burn high in the dark sky, but the Man sits motionless. His primal courage quashed, David’s overcome by the crush return of his fear. He clearly can’t believe what he’s witnessing. He moves in closer to investigate. Cautiously. Shields hi face from the heat with his hand. And then, once he’s within a few feet of the Man, somethi stops David in his tracks. Through the flames, he sees -- -- a badge. And a garrison belt. It’s not the Man; it’s t Security Guard. He’s been placed in the chair. David WHIPS his head to where the Security Guard last was He’s not there. An empty pool of blood on the concrete ma his absence. Realizing he’s been tricked, David SPINS around. A look of abject terror appears on his face. WE SEE why. The Man stands outside the vestibule, staring David, blocking any chance of escape in that direction. With little hesitation, he walks toward David. Upon turning to face the other direction, David sees he finally has a chance to make a run for it. INSERT - The Security Guard’s garrison belt. Covered in fire, the can of pepper spray deforms from the blistering heat.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Just as David takes his first step in that direction, preparing to dash to safety -- -- POP!! The pressurized can of pepper spray BURSTS. A mist BLASTS out from the Security Guard, covering David like a swarm of bees. He falls his knees, clutching at hi burning eyes in agony. Screaming. Writhing.  98. The Man halts his stride and watches David. Unflinchingly David tries desperately to see, but cannot. He falls to h knees, at the foot of the burning Security Guard. The screwdriver still in his hand. Suddenly, sirens are heard, getting louder by the second. The faint hue of flashing red and blue lights appear. Within seconds, several POLICE CARS come SCREAMING into t distant entrance of the parking lot, followed by a FIRE TRUCK. INT. POLICE CAR —- CONTINUOUS Through his windshield, a SERGEANT sees the burning Secur Guard, as well as David -- who is covered in blood, holdi the screwdriver, and screaming like a madman. The strobe lights inside and outside the vestibule contin to flash. Two cars are crashed into the vestibule. Robert dead body remains splayed out on the concrete.

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT
dialogues.text: What the hell...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The POLICE CARS speed toward this carnival of chaos. From his vantage point, now further back toward the vestibule, the Man notices the arriving phalanx of POLICE CARS. For a moment he edges forward, considering whether complete his attack. Instead, restraining himself, he cal slips into the shadows.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE VESTIBULE
dialogues.text: The POLICE CARS come to a SCREECHING halt. The Sergeant SWINGS open his door. Stands behind it. Trains his weapon on David.

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Get on the ground!! A PATROLMAN pulls out a SHOTGUN. Points it David.

dialogues.speaker: PATROLMAN
dialogues.text: Drop the weapon!! Still in tremendous pain and unable to see, David is non- compliant. He also has some difficulty hearing the Office over the glaring sound of the alarm and roaring wind.  99.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: No...what? I don’t...! SCHK-SCHK. The Patrolman cocks the SHOTGUN.

dialogues.speaker: PATROLMAN
dialogues.text: I said drop it!! David drops the screwdriver, though his wild, uncontrolla movement still appears threatening. Other POLICE OFFICERS pull out their weapons and train th on David. They all tactically inch their way closer to hi

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT
dialogues.text: Get on the God damn ground!! NOW!!

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: Help me...he’s still here!!

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT
dialogues.text: (to another Officer) Move in! Move in!! Two other Police Officers RUSH David. SMASH him down to t ground. Drop a knee into his back. Grab at his arms. David struggles. Resists.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: He’s right there!! He’s -- David's cut short by the weight of an Officer’s baton aga the back of his neck. He yells out in pain. Laying prostrate on the ground, David's wrists are handcuffed. The Firefighters move in fast. Attend to the burning Security Guard. With the Officers still pinning him face-first on the gro David lifts his head from the concrete. Looks toward the vestibule. The Man is gone.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No! NO!! After a beat, the Sergeant looks over at the vestibule. H does a double-take after catching a glimpse of Emily’s bo as well as Corey and Harold's.  100.

dialogues.speaker: SERGEANT
dialogues.text: We've got three more vics near the vestibule. Secure that area! Officers run off toward the vestibule, their guns drawn. David is YANKED to his feet and DRAGGED to a squad car. H fights back.

dialogues.speaker: DAVID
dialogues.text: What are you doing?! No! Wait -- The officers grip tight on David’s arms. Their hands feel like vices against his frozen skin. The Officer SHOVES hi into the backseat of the squad car. SLAM! He’s locked inside. David's head slumps against the window of the police car. His eyes burning red, his breath stolen from the blow fro the baton, all he can do is watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- A Fire Official turns off the sprinklers and fire alar EMTs lift Emily’s body from the vestibule. -- Police examine the scene, noting the broken security camera and display screen on the ATM. -- Detectives and Crime Scene Analysts photograph and dia the scene, including Corey’s body. -- A Detective opens the trunk to David’s car. Finds Robert's wallet, as well as the deposit envelope filled w cash and Corey’s watch. He also finds Emily’s cell phone, with 911 dialed and ready to be Sent. -- A Detective holds the spool of wire from David’s tool as he examines the wire perimeter. -- A Detective picks up the SCREWDRIVER with a pair of la gloves and places it into an evidence bag. -- Several dead bodies, now covered in white sheets, are wheeled on gurneys into the back of ambulances. -- Detectives review the black and white footage from the security camera located inside the ATM. In it, they see: David and Corey kicking the windows and the plaster wall, looking as though they’re attempting to break into the AT  101. David slamming Corey against the wall and the wrestling m that follows... David attacking and ultimately strangling Harold with the wire attached to the signing shelf pen... David shoving Emily, landing her hard against the floor.. David laying next to Corey, covered in blood. He moves aw and reveals that Corey has a screwdriver sticking from hi stomach. From the camera’s vantage point it appears as though David stabbed him... And David smashing the ATM with the base of the metal was basket until the security camera finally goes to static. But nowhere do they ever see the Man. Not in a single, solitary frame of the security camera video. Because he never came within ten feet of the vestibule, he remained outside the camera’s line of sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s as if he was never there. Furthermore, the water flooding the vestibule, Emily’s fa and the subsequent action, all came after David smashed i the camera, leaving no explanation for how it happened. One of the Detectives presses a button on the video playb It instantly brings the security camera footage back to a earlier position -- showing a close-up of David's face as takes money out of his account using the ATM. The close-up image of David’s face remains paused on the video playback screen like a mugshot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Detectives look at each other. One of them holds Davi swallowed ATM card. His name right on it: “DAVID HARGROVE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An early morning sun peeks over the horizon. Police tape cordons off the crime scene. The area is filled with Police and Fire officials. Emerge lights flash. Walkie-talkies crackle. David remains seated in the back of the police car. The Sergeant taps on the back of the squad car. Signals the Patrolman inside.  102. With that, the Patrolman starts the car. Turns on red and blues. Lets the siren blare. Officers pull back two wooden police barricades, allowing police car's egress. The police car cruises through the parting throng of onlookers and news reporters who have since gathered. INT. POLICE CAR —- CONTINUOUS Physically exhausted and emotionally bankrupt, David’s he falls to his chest. He languidly looks out the car window. Mixed amongst the crowd are several people wearing thick dark parkas, simil to the one the Man wore. David's eyes scan to see if the is among them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From within the crowd we watch the police car as it passe by. David turns and looks out the rear window as the police c heads further and further down the street. Until it’s gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: P.O.V. - A man’s outstretched arm hangs a THICK PARKA (th same one the Man wore) up inside a locker. His other arm reaches in and grabs an apron. He places the apron over h head and closes the locker door, revealing the reflection - THE MAN (stocky, cropped haircut, average looking). END P.O.V. The man runs his hands over his 5 o’clock shad before walking off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man stands behind the counter. We push in, revealing stencil on his apron. It reads - Seattle’s Finest Coffee. The push-in continues up to the man’s face. He waits patiently for customers to arrive.  103. Just another day. FADE OUT.
